perturbation.original_text: 10.1 Sponsorship, Advertising and Exclusivity Fees.  Client will pay Intuit sponsorship and advertising fees of $2,644,010 and an exclusivity fee of $661,003.  Such fees shall be paid to Intuit as follows.  An initial fee of $[***] shall be due and payable on the Effective Date.  The remaining balance of $[***] shall be paid to Intuit in 12 equal monthly installments of [***]. Each monthly installment should be payable in advance and due no later than the fifth (5th) of the month.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.1 Sponsorship, Advertising and Exclusivity Fees. Client will pay Intuit sponsorship and advertising fees of $2,644,010 and an exclusivity fee of $661,003. Such fees shall be paid to Intuit as follows. An initial fee of $[***] shall be due and payable on the Effective Date. The remaining balance of $[***] shall be paid to Intuit in 12 equal monthly installments of [***]. Each monthly installment is payable in arrears and due no later than the twenty-fifth (25th) of the month.
perturbation.explanation: Section 10.1 originally states that monthly installments are due no later than the fifth of the month but this change makes it due no later than the twenty-fifth of the month. This creates conflicting payment deadlines, causing uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: 12.2 Termination. Either party may terminate this Agreement if the other party materially breaches a material obligation hereunder and such breach remains uncured for thirty (30) days following the notice to the breaching party of the breach and the notifying party's intention to terminate.  All undisputed payments that have accrued prior to the termination or expiration of this Agreement for any reason will be payable in full within thirty (30) days thereof.  In addition, upon the termination of this Agreement by Client for any reason, a pro-rata amount of the Monthly Payment Fee shall be refunded to Client calculated as follows: the Monthly Payment Fee less the cost of the Impressions displayed for such month as of the effective date of the termination, calculated on an average CPM basis.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.2 Termination. Either party may terminate this Agreement if the other party materially breaches a material obligation hereunder and such breach remains uncured for sixty (60) days following the notice to the breaching party of the breach and the notifying party's intention to terminate. All undisputed payments that have accrued prior to the termination or expiration of this Agreement for any reason will be payable in full within fifteen (15) days thereof. In addition, upon the termination of this Agreement by Client for any reason, a pro-rata amount of the Monthly Payment Fee shall be refunded to Client calculated as follows: the Monthly Payment Fee less the cost of the Impressions displayed for such month as of the effective date of the termination, calculated on an average CPM basis.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text now states that a breach must remain uncured for sixty (60) days instead of thirty (30) before termination can occur, and accrued payments are due within fifteen (15) days instead of thirty (30).

perturbation.original_text: 18.3 Notice. Unless otherwise stated, all notices required under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be considered given (i) when delivered personally, (ii) within five (5) days of mailing, certified mail, return receipt requested and postage prepaid (iii) one (1) day after deposit with a commercial overnight carrier, or (iv) when delivered by facsimile transmission.  All communications will be addressed as follows (unless changed by notice):
perturbation.changed_text: 18.3 Notice. Unless otherwise stated, all notices required under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be considered given (i) only when delivered personally, (ii) within ten (10) days of mailing, certified mail, return receipt requested and postage prepaid (iii) five (5) days after deposit with a commercial overnight carrier, or (iv) only when delivered by electronic mail with confirmation of receipt. All communications will be addressed as follows (unless changed by notice):
perturbation.explanation: By modifying the notice clause, we introduce conflicting terms regarding how and when notices are considered given. The original clause allows for facsimile transmission, which is now disallowed. The changes introduce ambiguities about valid notification methods.
